text:
Welcome to HowToCookThat I'm Ann Reardon and
today we are making a fun, delicious fresh
Emoji Rainbow Fruit Slushie.
"Ok I think we'll go for the orange first.
And then we need to cut these up."

Just slice it in half and squeeze out the
juice, and then you want to place that juice

in the freezer to chill while we make our
other juices.

"And now I think we'll go for the strawberry
and we want to hull those, take off the green
bit"

And after you've done that wash them and then
put them into a blender and then we just want

to blitz them up to make nice, yummy fresh
strawberry juice.

"Ok now I think we'll go for a yellowy layer
so for that we will use a banana... hmm already
peeled.
So we just need to chop it"

Place it in the blender, now that will go
brown if we don't add the juice of a lemon.
"So let's grab one of those."

Then slice it in half, juice it and pour that
juice in with the bananas and then just turn

that on to blend and blend it up until it's
smooth.
"What shall we do our next layer with?

How about one of my favourites some yummy
fresh grapes?"

Wash the grapes and put them into a juicer
and collect all that fresh grape juice.

If you don't have a juicer you could buy grape
juice from the store instead but I kind of
love how this is all fresh fruit.

"And for our next layer lets use some pineapple,
wow that's a bit heavy."
Slice a thin layer of the green off the pineapple.
Then cut it into quarters.

Push them into the juicer and it will filter
out all those little bits that we didn't cut
off.

Again you can buy pipeapple juice from the
store if you don't have a juicer.

"How fun is it getting all our ingredients
straight fresh from the market.
Ok for this layer lets use a pear.
Awesome."

Wash it, chop it up and place it in a juicer
and push it down ... and collect the fresh
pear juice.

"And this next one we are going to use something
that is really yummy, we are going to use
some watermelon.

This is one of my favourite fruits ... make
sure you leave a comment below with the emoji
of your favourite fruit.

And then we need to slice this to take the
rind off it."
And cut it into chunks.

Place those chunks into a blender and blitz
that to make watermelon juice.
Now to turn all these juices into slushie.

Pour the cold grape juice into an icecream
maker and churn that for a few minutes until
it is soft and slushie.

The colder your juice is the quicker this
will happen.

That's why I said to put the juices into the
freezer while we were waiting.

Add some the bottom of the glass and shake
it to level it off.

Then repeat that with the strawberry juice,
now while this next one is churning store

the glasses in the freezer so the first layer
doesn't melt.

I found it easiest with the bottom layers
to use a piping bag to get it all the way

down to the bottom without getting it smeared
all up the sides of the top of the glass.

The watermelon and strawberry juice are very
similar in colour but they taste so different
that it's good having them both there.
Churn the orange and add that to the top.

And then follow that up with the pineapple,
I could of been a bit more generous with the
orange layer there but never mind.

Add the layer of banana and lemon juice mixed
together, you can do this with less fruits

if you want or you could do it with all one
fruit.

Sometimes we churn one fruit slushie, add
generous spoonfuls to a glasses and top it
with lemonade and that's always yummy too.

Then add the pear on top, I've added a little
green food colouring to it so it wasn't so
pale.

And there you have a rainbow fruit slushie
with grapes, strawberries, watermelon, orange,
pineapple, banana and lemon and pear on top.
And it tastes so fresh.

Hmm, I just got the watermelon, let's move
it up a bit.

Pineapple and definitely pear, so it depends
where your straw is as to what flavour you
get.

You can taste them all in there, just gorgeous,
you have to try this.

Subscribe to HowToCookThat for more cakes,
chocolates and desserts.

Click here, or on the little 'i' in the corner,
for the recipe details, here for my Watermelon
Dessert, here for more of my videos.
Make it a great week and I'll see you Friday.
